description: Compare German äugeln (“to ogle”). More at eye, -le.

entries.meaning: An impertinent, flirtatious, amorous or covetous stare.
(Polari, usually in the plural) An eye.

verbs.description: ogle (third-person singular simple present ogles, present participle ogling, simple past and past participle ogled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To stare at (someone or something), especially impertinently, amorously, or covetously.
